laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Elevated 18 years after the initial surgery, after which the patient experienced clinical and biochemical recurrence.

laboratory_examinations.findings: High UETM levels initially, which normalized after surgery.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased UETM levels after surgery 2 years later, followed by further surgical resection treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: High concentration of urinary VMA (189 mg/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months after surgery, UETM was normal. Elevated UETM returned four years later, indicating recurrence.
Decreased to normal levels after surgery, then increased after two years with symptoms; further surgery and treatment indicated.
Normal levels five months after surgery, but elevated levels were noted 16 years later with symptoms of hypertension.
